intro: Aciphylla colensoi var. conspicua, commonly known as the showy spinifex, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that resembles a cushion. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in coastal and inland sandy soils, often in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
